Package edu.ncsu.csc216.requirements_manager.model.user_story

Class UserStory

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.requirements_manager.model.user_story.UserStory
public class UserStory extends Object
Method stores all information related to a UserStory and its state. Stored in an ArrayList in the project class.
Author:
jeff

    • submittedState

      public final edu.ncsu.csc216.requirements_manager.model.user_story.UserStory.UserStoryState submittedState
      Only one instance of this state is constructed for performance and simplicity of code reasons. When the state of the project changes, the currentState variable is updated to reflect one of these.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserStory

      public UserStory(int id, String state, String title, String user, String action, String value, String priority, String developerId, String rejectionReason)
      Default constructor for controller class to use to create a story. Used if the story already exists and is being modified rather than for newly submitted stories.
      Parameters:
      id - ID of the story to be created
      state - Current state of the system. Has predefined values from the requirements
      title - Title of a story
      user - Name of person creating story
      action - Action user would like to be able to do
      value - Why the user wants to be able to do an action
      priority - Urgency of implementing the story
      developerId - ID of developer assigned to the story
      rejectionReason - Why the project is rejected. Can only be Duplicate, Inappropriate, or Infeasible

    • UserStory

      public UserStory(String title, String user, String action, String value)
      Creates a freshly submitted user story. State should default to submitted and no other fields need be populated other than title, user, action, and value.
      Parameters:
      title - Title of a story
      user - Name of person creating story
      action - Action user would like to be able to do
      value - Why the user wants to be able to do an action

  • Method Details

    • getState

      public String getState()
      Method fetches current state of story as a string
      Returns:
      State of a story as a string

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Method fetches the numerical ID for a story. Used as a unique identifier
      Returns:
      the storyId as an int

    • getTitle

      public String getTitle()
      Returns the title of a story. Cannot be null or empty
      Returns:
      the title as a String

    • getAction

      public String getAction()
      Fetches action user would like to see implemented
      Returns:
      the action as a String

    • getValue

      public String getValue()
      Fetches the reason user wants to see an action implemented
      Returns:
      the value as a String

    • getPriority

      public String getPriority()
      Method returns the priority of a story
      Returns:
      the priority as a String

    • getDeveloperId

      public String getDeveloperId()
      Method returns developerID of the developer working on a project
      Returns:
      the developerId of the person working on the project

    • getRejectionReason

      public String getRejectionReason()
      Returns the reason a story was rejected. Can be Inappropriate, Infeasible, or Duplicate.
      Returns:
      the rejectionReason as a String

    • getUser

      public String getUser()
      Returns the name of the user who created the story
      Returns:
      the name of the user as a String

    • setUser

      public void setUser(String user)
      Sets the name of the user who created the story
      Parameters:
      user - the user to set as a String

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Converts a user story into a String to be printed into a file. Special format based off project requirements
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      relevant information about a project in a String format

    • update

      public void update(Command command)
      Method updates a story's state via a command provided as an argument
      Parameters:
      command - Command used to update the state of a project and change relevant variables.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if Command would transition a project to an undefined state

    • setCounter

      public static void setCounter(int idx)
      Method initiates counter field used to keep track of the highest ID story in the project
      Parameters:
      idx - Index of the highest id numbered story in the project

    • incrementCounter

      public static void incrementCounter()
      Method increases counter field by one every time a new user story is made in a project
